children.subject: well you got an offer you're happy with so that's great! getting an offer can be super time consuming so the fact you only did like -1 sd below on first midterms is fine I think. I had that experience in my sophomore and junior year. I guess that's just how it goes. we are only through the first midterms so far so you totally have time to catch up. don't let your worries get you down. just focus on what motivates you and encourages you. the fact that you got a great internship and are still afloat in your classes at the same time says that you are focused and you can definitely power through.

history.content:
Well now you have more time so definitely dedicate that to your classes. Specifically for the fifth year masters your goal should be 3.5+ gpa. 

No need to balance now since you are done, right? Now you can focus on classes as well as research/finding research + advisor since that is crucial for the fifth year masters program. 

Tips for balancing is try not to be singularly focused on things. For example if an exam or an interview is coming up, still do work for your other classes and focus on the upcoming thing, instead of just dedicating time to the upcoming thing. That will help you go from playing catch up with each class to being on top of them and balancing it with everything else you have going on in your life.

Good luck!

My goal is to get into the 5th year masters program, but also to have a good career. In the beginning of this year, I spent a lot of time on leetcode/interviews and was able to get an internship offer I am happy with, but as a result my grades suffered badly, and I scored close to -1 sd on the first midterm for a lot of my classes because I just didn't have time to study for them. Now that I signed an offer I am working hard on trying to catch up in my classes but I feel the damage has already been done :(

Does anyone have any tips on how to balance these two?
history.subject: Don't know how to balance career vs school
